results.title: From sociable six to noisy nine [col]
results.creator_credit: Judith Crawley, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film looks into the meaning of various forms of conduct in children from six to nine years and suggests ways in which parents may guide them through a challenging, often trying phase of development. In a family with three children we observe how the parents cope with often baffling situations.

results.title: From silence to speech
results.brief_description: Training children to speak in Victorian institutions for the education of the deaf. It is essential that deaf children begin education early, and at the Princess Elizabeth Kindergarten, children are taught to lipread in order to associate lip movements with vocal sounds. As they grow older, children continue to the Victorian School for Deaf Children where they continue speech training, commence primary education, play games, learn handcrafts, carpentry and domestic training.

results.title: From school to work bench
results.brief_description: The training of the future skilled workers of West Germany. At the end of an elementary school education boys and girls are tested by vocational guidance experts; visits to factories, agricultural schools, business and domestic science colleges etc give an insight into the demands and qualifications required for the many skilled crafts and the simplest professions of this modern age.

results.title: From runaway to hippie
results.brief_description: A critical view of the “drop-out” society includes a report on drug abuse among American Juvenile delinquents and their attraction to communities such as the San Francisco Hippies. Designed as a warning to young people against the dangers of drug taking, the film also claims that interest in drugs is stimulated by the mass media.

results.title: From one cell
results.brief_description: This is a special-purpose film prepared for showing by biology teachers for class-room use. The subject of cancer is introduced objectively and unemotionally as one of the basic phenomenon of growth. The concept of cell growth and cell division is presented in terms which provoke interest in the as yet unanswered questions of abnormal cell behaviour.

results.title: From king to congress
results.creator_credit: Billy James Parrott and Guggenheim Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the campaign of Andrew Young, a black man running for the U.S. House of Representatives from Atlanta, Georgia. Young was associated with the late Martin Luther King. Young, and his opponent, a politically moderate white, are shown campaigning and debating issues. Supporters of each and the work involved is illustrated as well as comments by supporters and others.

results.title: From Glasgow Green to Bendigo
results.creator_credit: Robert Irvine, Anglo-Scottish Pictures and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: The design, manufacture and export of carpets. Highly skilled craftsment in a Glasgow factory are seen creating carpets from the basic design through intricate processes to the finished article. Carpets made for the Coronation, the White House, government buildings in New Zealand, South Africa and Rhodesia and in private homes, including one in Bendigo, Victoria.

results.title: From every shires ende
results.brief_description: Life in Mediaeval England as illustrated in manuscripts, carvings, brasses etc of the time, combined with views of castles, churches and the countryside along the route of the Canterbury Pilgrims, presenting some of the background of Chaucer’s Tales.
